item.title: Can't Hurt Me: Challenge #3
item.description: Write down all the things you donâ€™t like to do or that make you uncomfortable. Especially those things you know are good for you. Now go do one of them, and do it again.

item.title: Can't Hurt Me: Challenge #2
item.description: I tacked Post-It notes on my Accountability Mirror, and Iâ€™ll ask you to do the same. Digital devices wonâ€™t work. Write all your insecurities, dreams, and goals on Post-Its and tag up your mirror.

item.title: Can't Hurt Me: Challenge #1
item.description: What are the current factors limiting your growth and success? Write them out in minute detail. Donâ€™t be bland with this assignment. I showed you every piece of my dirty laundry.

item.title: March: In Review
item.description: March tends to be a nice month for me. It’s the month I was born, and it’s the first month that’s not February, which is by far my least favorite month of the year.

item.title: February: In Review
item.description: Happy leapt year! February went fast, even with that extra day. Here in Seattle, I find it best to have plans during the wet weeks. Spend time with friends and family, ski on the weekends, go to the gym, write down your thoughts.

item.title: January: In Review
item.description: In this post I’ll cover some highlights from January, my media of the month, my performance on January objectives, and my goals going into February.

item.title: The Power Grid
item.description: “Electricity is not like anything else. It’s not a solid, or a liquid, or a gas. It doesn’t move like the wind or tides. It doesn’t combust like oil or burn like wood.

item.title: Documentaries
item.description: I love documentaries. Here are a few. The Game Changers Game Changers focuses on the benefits of plant-based diets through the lense of professional atheletes. While the film touches on the environmental impact and animal cruelity side of meat production, it centers on the health implications of mass-consumption of animal protein.

item.title: Time Travel Movies
item.description: I love stories that mess with time. Seeing characters interact over vastly different time periods is pure movie magic. I initially wrote captions for each of these, but found them more powerful without.

item.title: A New Year is Here
item.description: Welcome to my freshly minted website. This post covers highlights from the past year as well as my goal-setting strategem going in to 2020. Highlights of 2019 2019 - The Best We Could Do Last year I wrote a personal review of the year prior, with set goals going into 2019Â¹.
Conspiracy Theories It’s difficult for me to understand where conspiricy comes from. College educated, living in a big, coastal city city, married with two dogs and two well-paying jobs.
